Welcome to Physics 307!

2 October agenda

  • Do a retrospective of Project 3
  • Talk about dealing with second order differential equations
  • Get started on Project 4

New notes: on symplectic solvers and making animations

Note: To install anim on your computer, see the instructions here

20 September agenda:

  • Do a retrospective of Project 2
  • Talk about differential equations and how to solve them
  • Get started on Project 3

New notes: on differential equation solvers

11 September agenda:

  • Do a retrospective of Project 1 and see how far you all are
  • Talk about numerical integration methods and introduce Project 2
  • Introduce the idea of power-law scaling and log/log plots
  • Introduce functions in C

New notes:

  • Functions in C
  • Analysis of integration methods

6 September agenda:

  • talk about conditionals (if/then/else) and a few odds and ends you need to do next week’s homework
  • work on Project 1

New notes: make sure you look at the sample programs.

Notes that might be helpful:

  • Intro to Linux, section 3: input and output redirection
  • Intro to Linux, section 4: graphing functions
  • Intro to C, sections 2 and 3: math and loops

30 August agenda:

  • talk briefly about what this class will be, and what you can expect
    • I gave a talk on SU’s Physics 307 class at the American Association of Physics Teachers conference this summer; here are the slides if anyone’d like to read them.
  • introduce you to the folks teaching this class
  • ensure everyone can log into the course computer
  • introduce some basic Linux commands and the C programming language
  • guide everyone through writing their first C program!
